alert.note: Alert for Cochise (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 04 at 11:28AM MST until July 04 at 1:00PM MST by NWS Tucson
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 230 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Wash and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Southeast Arizona, including the following county, Cochise. This includes the area around the Chiricahua National Monument. * WHEN...Until 230 PM MST. * IMPACTS...Rises in small streams and normally dry washes. Some low-water crossings may become impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1125 AM MST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause wash and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Silver Creek, Wood Canyon, East Turkey Creek, Cave Creek, Onion Creek, Turkey Creek, South Fork Keating Creek, Indian Creek, Big Sand Wash, East Whitetail Creek, San Simon River, and Keating Creek. Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Chiricahua National Monument and Paradise. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks. CC
